Title: PAM S/Key: Information disclosure
Synopsis:
PAM S/Key does not clear provided credentials from memory, allowing
    local attackers to gain access to cleartext credentials.

Background.Text: PAM S/Key is a pluggable authentication module for the OpenBSD Single-key Password system.

Description.Text: Ulrich MÃ¼ller reported that a Gentoo patch to PAM S/Key does not remove credentials provided by the user from memory.

Impact.Text: A local attacker with privileged access could inspect a memory dump to gain access to cleartext credentials provided by users.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All PAM S/Key users should upgrade to the latest version:
